title: Culture Territories
segmentation: Hi everybody, thanks for having us here.
It's only three of us today, but we represent Culture Territories Association.
We are multidisciplinary team in which pretty much everybody comes from very different backgrounds.
We have different interests, we have different experience.
But what we have in common is that we recognize architecture as culturali active space and the space that flourish is when it receives care and attention.
And it fades away when it's neglected.
So that's why we Orient our actions to buildings which represent quality but underperforming architecture buildings, which are usually forgotten, abandoned, or simply excluded from local environment.
So we come up we come up with a simple instruction on how to bring those buildings into local consciousness we bring.
In four steps that you can see here, we bring culture to inactive territories too in order to boost their potentials, and in order to activate their own culture creating abilities.
So the first step is about looking for.
Buildings, specially architecture which are located in Terra Fereos, specially small villages and towns.
Small towns in the peripheries.
The buildings which are excluded from the consciousness of local community.
The condition of required for implementing this scheme before.
Is awareness of the context.
It gives us base for researching the area that we work in.
We tried to find.
Specific architectural elements which are which local people can identify.
We've an treat as they own.
Their installation, which we already made in a little Polish mountain town of Valley Groot, in the Orthodox Church.
Where about highlight things this elements.
So the first installation was designed with a parametric algorithm and founded by me and my father.
And then just the first step of the process is just to open this building for them to these people.
This installation it highlighted holy icons and this culture in the presbytery which represent typical handcrafted arts of this region.
And the second one was about characteristic onion shaped root details, which are typical for these types of churches.
In this case, we use the idea of crowdfunding.
Crowdfunding is like a contemporary a solution, but it's already there.
Also in the villages.
But we use this crowd funding and technology of 3D printing and everybody who wanted to create these installation and have also 3D printer.
Can 3D print the one or more elements?
So this is our intervention and we felt that the intervention is the next part of the architectural process.
The buildings are.
All of the time in the process we not finish it.
When we finished the just the design.
So.
The changes that we introduced to the needed space have temporary on Spartan, noninvasive character which are implemented in the workshop formula.
So for that reason we are looking for architects and we want to invite architects so you to our intervention.
To finding the best solution, the best direction to also give in the new life.
For these buildings an in the next step, maybe renovation.
When we start working the door to the buildings is always open.
It's important to us to make our work visible to everybody who is passing by.
To this.
And to this space, Ann want to look inside and see what is going on.
But on the other side, we realize that just to open the space and just to build the installation there, it's not enough.
We need a stronger impact and kind of a framework that will make our idea clear, approachable and first of all also interesting for the receivers.
So further locals.
And it's simply how we came up with the idea of.
Creating like organized events such as exhibition, concert screening or anything, this is a natural consequence of our very multidisciplinary team.
Yes, because in our team, not everybody is the architectural student architect like a founder.
Lucash, Adrian, for example, is specified in.
Parametric design and new technologies that were already included in the last installation.
There is ignition Kouba who has have experienced in workshops.
There is Natalia Filmmaker who is documenting all the process and there an me musician and I'm responsible for.

Art site of the event and we really, strongly believe in this idea and we really, strongly believe that this final event is kind of a crowning touch and also to all the work that we put inside this chosen space and also kind of a confrontation between locals between receivers and idea that we introduced to them also.
Undoubtedly it's a great opportunity for us because we're still.

Quite young, so for young creators to see the result of our project in a real situation, real life not only in University space and to get an instant feedback, for example, it was really surprising for us when we from somebody who came, he said that it wasn't even his first concert in this place or in Orthodox Church, but also his first concert ever.
And this is a big thing, I think.
Um?
And we believe that exposing people to any solutions and new ideas helps to enforce different view of the space that they've already known and helps to encourage them to take their own initiatives.
Hopefully this new positive approach, the building?
Yeah, that's another.
Oh yeah, we missed lots of pictures.
OK.
That's mine, that's that's illegal.
Spark trivialize.
Yeah, OK, hopefully this new positive approach will solidify so that previously overlooked architecture is now going to be embraced and re stablished.
We hope that our actions are going to leave a permanent mark in local mentality and they can begin near creativity processes in this area.
And we don't count on huge changes.
We want to influence individuals and we want to activate.
Local institutions that are already there and it seems to work.

'cause for example after the first installation that was built in that was built in Valley growth in this Orthodox Church, local people insisted on preserving this installation for a whole year because they wanted to organize your own exhibitions in a frame of our installation.
So the.
Conclusion is that we know it's going to work because we've already done it before, and now we want you to see the video to see how it what it looked like in Bali growth.
Listen.
